text.__SUMMARY__:
Salvia unguella is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae that is native to Ecuador.
Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist montane forests.
text.Sources: Montúfar, R. & Pitman, N. (2004). "Salvia unguella". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 2004: e.T45580A11001506. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T45580A11001506.en. Retrieved 18 December 2017.
